Description: Furniture ornament; silver with gilding; hollowed, one-piece casting; rectangular socket: square in section; framed with rectilinear moulding; soldering plate and one link of safety chain with two aligned holes; terminating in a seated female figure representing the Tyche of Rome: plastically rendered, detailed with decorative engraving, stippling and gilded drapery; figure wears tunic, mantle, boots, armlet and crested helmet and holds a staff and shield; below the figure: hinged, pierced, stippled and punched leaf with rounded knob finial. One of a set with 1866,1229.22, 23 and 24.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: San Francesco di Paola ai Monti, convent building (ruin of) (grounds)
Curator's comments: For metallurgical analysis see: M.J. Hughes and J.A. Hall, "X-ray Fluorescence Analysis of Late Roman and Sassanian Silver", Journal of Archaeological Science 6 (1979), pp. 327 and 343-44. In set with 1866,1229.22-24.
